nodes.bodyText: Why put this in 10k? Is there any testing, which could prove this provides better performance?

In our production environment, it's 100k. However, considering that most people try skywalking, the machine configuration is not so high, and this is a configurable item, so the initial value is set to 10k.
I am a little concern about the size, whether it is too big for a normal user.
I think this description is not correct, you just separate the config, can't avoid that thing
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -87,6 +87,7 @@
 * Fix end time bug in the query process.
 * Fix `Exporter INCREMENT mode` is not working.
 * Fix an error when executing startup.bat when the log directory exists
+* Add syncBulkActions config to avoid the large amount of metrics data written ES in a single sync bulk request.

nodes.bodyText:
Could change this to

Add syncBulkActions configuration to set up the batch size of the metrics persistent.
